page.title: 07THE SWING BRIDGE,NEWCASTLE
page.content: The {Swing Bridge}was designed and built by{Lord Armstrong}in 1876 at the cost of Â£240000.It stands on the site of Newcastle's first Roman bridge. Weighing more than 1200 tons, it was designed to swing open to allow ships to pass through on their way to and from the {coal staithes}at Dunston. Today the staithes are closed and very little coal passes down the river. The team of men who once worked on the bridge has been reduced from 19 to 6. The{hydraulic gear}is still in full working order and is regularly serviced. The paintwork is white so that the sunlight is reflected and the bridge does not expand. Mr.Pringle showed us around and told us that when he retires next year, he hopes that he is given a penny for every rivet in the bridge.
